alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; East Laramie County; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued February 22 at 3:14AM MST until February 24 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Extremely dangerous wind chills as low as 35 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Much of southeast Wyoming and the western Nebraska Panhandle. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Dangerously cold wind chills could lead to frostbite on exposed skin in 5 minutes or less. Hypothermia can develop quickly if precautions are not taken. In addition, some roadways may be slick or snow covered do to snow showers in the area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Another round of light snow is possible late Tuesday night through Wednesday. Additional accumulations of 1 to 3 inches will be possible.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, knit hat, and mittens.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; East Laramie County; South Laramie Range Foothills
